comments:
Build ID: eclipse.buildId=I20070625-1500

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Installed DB2 on Linux box with the Sample database
2. Downloaded and installed latest all-in-one of WTP & Eclipse.
3. Create the connection to the database using the SQL Model-JDBC Connection.
4. Attempt to Generate Entities against the DB2 sample database. Act, Catalog, ClSched and Customer work fine.  The Department table fails with 'Unhandled event loop exception'


More information:
Session Data:
java.version=1.6.0_01
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_CA
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86

Tim,

I don't have the DB2 Sample DB handy.  Can you point me to the DDL, or attach a DDL script to use to reproduce the problem.

Thanks.
I've been unable to reproduce this on a non-DB2 database, which makes it likely that this is a DTP issue with their DB2 support.  We will investigate further and try to get to the root of the issue.
*** Bug 209806 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
I'm downloading DB2 Express to try and see if I can reproduce this error.

We have run into this NPE as well in the same scenario.

In looking into it, the Department table appears to have multiple FKs while the other tables have only one FK -- so it's possible that having multiple FKs may be related to the problem.
I finally got around to reproducing this on DB2, and from what I can tell it is a DTP problem specific to DB2 FK metadata.  Please see bug 212306 for more information.
